title.narrative: Uganda Health Systems Strengthening Project - UHSSP

description.narrative: (Uganda): With $2,385,000 in FY 2020 funds, this activity will focus on improved leadership and accountability for results at each level of the health sector, increased availability and improved management of key health systems resources including health financing and human resources, and strengthened community systems for quality health services. .UHSS has been engaged in the development of the National Community Engagement and Social Protection strategy (NCESP) that focuses on improving community involvement in the delivery of primary health services which includes maternal, newborn, and child health (MNCH) and family planning (FP). UHSS will continue to support the Ministry of Health (MoH) to translate the NCESP into the broader community health roadmap and community health policy which will focus on primary health care services. This activity will also aid in the development of the Community Health Extension Worker policy to help address the human resource constraints at the community level. .The UHSS team is supporting the MoH with human resources for health (HRH) in the following key areas: support with recruitment of critical health professionals (clinicians, nurses, etc) at the district and health facility levels; the development of a national HRH strategy for year 2020-2030; and on the re-structure of critical service care delivery, including MNCH. UHSS will monitor and support HRH recruitment of key positions at MoH, including those relevant to MNCH, nutrition, and FP..UHSS efforts will focus on public financial management support, including the planning, budgeting, and budget execution. This activity will transfer to secondary advisors, who will continue monitoring the use of GAVI the vaccine alliance and the Global Financing Facility/World Bank MNCH project fund use, and identifying where there are challenges, and linkages to service delivery outcomes..
